text: Cosimo Di Ceglie (October 21, 1913, Andria - 1980, Milan) was an Italian jazz guitarist. Di Ceglie played with local bands in Andria before joining Herb Flemming's group in the mid-1930s. He recorded with Piero Rizza and the Orchestra del Circolo Jazz Hot di Milano, as well as under his own name, in the period 1936-1938, then worked with Enzo Ceragioli and Kramer Gorni around 1940.Adriano Mazzoletti, "Cosimo Di Ceglie". The New Grove Dictionary of Jazz. 2nd edition, ed. Barry Kernfeld. He was active during World War II on radio, playing with a six-piece ensemble, and made further recordings under his own name in the late 1940s and in the 1950s. He also played with Adriano Celentano, Kai Hyttinen, and others later in his career. ==References== Category:Italian jazz guitarists Category:1913 births Category:1980 deaths Category:20th-century guitarists
title: Cosimo Di Ceglie
